required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: CD19 CAR-T Cell Therapy for Relapsed/Refractory B-cell Lymphoma and B-cell Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I Clinical Trial of Anti-CD19 Chimeric Antigen Receptor With Synthetic Biology Optimizing Nano-vector T Cells Injection for Subjects With Relapsed/Refractory/High-risk B-cell Lymphoma and B-cell Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia

lead_sponsor.agency: Yan'an Affiliated Hospital of Kunming Medical University

clinical_study.source: Yan'an Affiliated Hospital of Kunming Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this study is to evaluate the safety and clinical activity of anti-CD19 Chimeric Antigen Receptor T cells (KD-019 CAR-T)infusion in the treatment of relapsed/refractory B-cell Lymphoma and B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia （B-ALL）.

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators designed an KD-019 Chimeric Antigen Receptor(CAR) with FMC63 single-chain antibody fragment (Scfv). This CAR has a CD8 hinge and transmembrane domains and a 4-1BB costimulatory domain; T cells expressing this CAR release relatively low levels of cytokines. Subjects with relapsed/refractory CD19-positive B-cell Lymphoma and B-ALL can participate if all eligibility criteria are met. Subjects receive chemotherapy prior to the infusion of KD-019 CAR-T cells. After the infusion, subjects will accept follow-up for side effects and effect of KD-019 CAR-T cells by the sponsor. Study procedures may be performed while hospitalized.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with severe cytokine release syndrome(CRS) as a Measure of Safety and Tolerability.
primary_outcome.description: The severe CRS post KD-019 CAR-T cells treatment will be evaluated and the maximum tolerated dose will be determined.

primary_outcome.measure: Copies numbers of CAR in peripheral blood (PB)
primary_outcome.description: Copies numbers of CAR in peripheral blood (PB)

secondary_outcome.description: For all subjects, overall survival refers to the period from being included in the test group to death caused by any reason

arm_group.description: Dosage form：injection Dosage:1-5x10^6/kg, 70ml/time, The CAR-T cells will be administered by i.v. injection over 20-30 minutes Frequency: total one time

intervention.description: Autologous genetically modified anti-CD19 CAR transduced T cells
